Oh, yes. {nl}We've made a bunch of traps in the Solitary Confinement District{nl}on the orders of the bishop quite some time ago.{nl}I learned this back when I was an apprentice... {nl}It's a trap to lure monsters to a apparition that looks like me.{nl}
I didn't say anything about them because I feared Irma {nl}might have gotten caught, but I think it's safe now.{nl}If you happen to go there, please be my guest and use the traps.{nl}
There are other places where we've prepared hideouts out of the prison as well.{nl}To exaggerate a little, we made so many that we could evacuate the population of Orsha.
Did the demons fall for the traps?{nl}I'd never used them on demons before, so I was a little worried.{nl}
I'm so glad that they worked as intended.{nl}
Do you... by any chance remember?{nl}I'm sure that the bishop would have mentioned it.{nl}
If you really are the Revelator, you will be able to stand against Demon Lords with your strength.{nl}
The reason we chose this place to hide the Demon Orders is because of the Confession Altar.{nl}It's the altar that the goddess gave her final blessing to the inmates that made their confessions.{nl}
It's been a while since the prison was shut down, but the effects from the blessings are still there.{nl}Your powers as Revelator should be enough to liberate that energy.
The cursed idols must be destroyed in order for me to open the portal to the Penitence Room.{nl}I can't do a thing because of this heavy and blasphemous energy.{nl}
There are two Confession Altars...{nl}But let's try the one on the left since it is closer.
The demons seemed to have noticed something is happening.{nl}But the cursed idol still stands...
I am grateful that everything seems to be going well ever since I've met you...{nl}But I am also nervous at the same time. {nl}Especially about the fact that Marnox is so quiet.
I told you there were two altars.{nl}Now all we can do is hope that the one in the oratory will do it's job.{nl}
I pray that the goddess look over us and grant us with success...
Please be careful that Marnox doesn't notice you.{nl}That arrogant Demon Lord will not look on as he lost me.
You've succeeded!{nl}I feel the curse being lifted.{nl}
Now, the cursed idols should be nothing more than mere pieces of wood!
You know what's strange?{nl}Marnox wouldn't leave us to interrupt his plans like this...{nl}
I guess it's all for the best.{nl}Maybe he underestimated you and got caught off guard.{nl}
Let's not let down the pace and go destroy the cursed idol in the 2nd Watchtower.{nl}I'll get the portal to the Penitence Room ready.
I won't forget the arrogant gestures and expressions Marnox used when he caught me.{nl}He said that he could crush the Revelator or anything else that stands in his way...
I thought it was strange that the demons weren't reacting...{nl}They've been preparing there all along.{nl}
But Marnox still didn't come back.{nl}Demons will never be able to open the chest that holds the Demon Orders,{nl}so where else could he be?{nl}
I guess he might be planning his next move while he sends his servants.{nl}I'll open the portal since we can't afford to tarry any longer.
Please be right behind me when I open the portal.{nl}Let's head back to the bishop as soon as we have the Demon Orders.
You've defeated Marnox...{nl}Euah...
{nl}I think my wounds are quite deep...
It was an honor that I could see the church achieve its mission.{nl}It's all thanks to you.{nl}
Don't worry about me, take the Demon Orders to the bishop.{nl}I'm a priest, remember? I'll be fine if I get to rest a little.
Is it true?{nl}You've... defeated Marnox?!{nl}
All we could do was run even when all of us attacked him together...{nl}I see that a Revelator has remarkable powers.{nl}
To see all the priests alive and well... it's a relief.{nl}I assume that we shall meet in Orsha soon.
I'm really okay. I'll recover my strength if I rest here a while, {nl}so please go and give the Demon Orders to the bishop.{nl}Don't forget to give him my regards.
Now that we've recovered the Demon Orders... Let's head back to Orsha.{nl}
The lord tends to attempt to act tough. She is strong, but gentle.{nl}I'm sure she's more worried than anyone else.{nl}
I'll head back to Orsha and meet with the lord before continuing {nl}with the interpretation of the Demon Orders.{nl}Why don't you meet with her again?
I shall see you in Orsha then.{nl}I'll make my leave since the interpretation of the Demon Orders is a pressing matter.
I have heard of what you've done from Bishop Urbonas.{nl}All that you've done for us... I don't know how to thank you.{nl}
I also knew of the legends passed down by the bishops of Orsha.{nl}I never thought that the Revelator of the same legends {nl}would be the one to save Bishop Urbonas...
The person that will save not only Orsha, but also the goddesses and the world...{nl}It is an honor to meet that Revelator.{nl}
It seems as if the goddesses have not forsaken Orsha even if they have all disappeared.{nl}I wish I could let everyone know of your deeds but...{nl}
I am sorry. I cannot announce that demons have come this close to the city.{nl}I hope that you will understand the fact that I {nl}cannot spread confusion and fear among my people.{nl}
I thank you once more as the lord of Orsha for what you have done.{nl}Bishop Urbonas will be waiting for you.
Greetings. Impeccable timing! {nl}I've just finished the final interpretation of the Demon Orders.{nl}
There may be a few parts where its inaccurate but...{nl}Allow me to explain with a bit of a liberal translation.{nl}
You may leave the human lord alone since we have obtained the holy power we were after.{nl}Miss Giltine wants more tangible results.{nl}
Deploy the Kruvina in the predetermined reservoir and execute the spore plan.{nl}Death will engulf this world.{nl}
P.S. Miss Giltine has ordered the annihilation of the Revelator.{nl}You must get rid of the Revelator before they meet the girl.{nl}
This is all of it.{nl}Its contents are so intimidating that I wonder if I actually translated it properly...{nl}
I will pass this information to the lord...{nl}It is frustrating since we can barely protect Orsha much less send out investigation parties.{nl}
What could this 'Kruvina' possibly be...{nl}I couldn't find anything mentioned in any of the old texts either.{nl}
Now, Revelator... What is your next plan?{nl}It may be simply the worries of an old man, {nl}but the spore plan mentioned in the Demon Orders...{nl}
Spores are merely the seeds of mushrooms or ferns and such.{nl}I can't help but wonder if the plan has anything to do with the Koru Jungle famed for its ferns...{nl}
The choice is yours, of course.{nl}Although our meeting may have been a coincidence, you did save me.{nl}
I am sure that the goddess has arranged it so that all of your travels lead to the salvation of all...{nl}
I bid thee well.{nl}I shall pray for the deliverance and blessings of the goddesses {nl}to lead and protect you on your journey.
I hope that you will keep a place in your heart for Orsha.{nl}The people of Orsha will always welcome you here.
Until now, we thought of the demons below Demon Lords...{nl}Little more than larger and more vicious monsters.{nl}

We never thought that they would have such a detailed{nl}command structure and threaten us like this.{nl}We will have to research their command structure in more detail {nl}to respond to them more effectively.{nl}
If you ever have the chance to face the demons at Felon Prison...{nl}Could you possibly collect Marnox's Insignias for me?{nl}{nl}
The entire church was swayed by a single Demon Lord...{nl}How powerful do you think a Demon King or Demon Goddess might be?
Thank you! {nl}I'll go straight to Orsha to research this subject as soon as things are settled here.{nl}
Ah... It is a pleasure to meet you.{nl}I've heard from Irja... that you're 'that Revelator'.{nl}
But we didn't know that they'd threaten us with such an organized structure.{nl}We'll need to confirm their command structure once things are settled here.{nl}
Could you gather Marnox's Insignias when you deal with the demons in the Felon Prison?{nl}I think we'll be able to research the demon's command structure with those.
It's a relief seeing Irma safe after being captured by Marnox.{nl}Now all we have to do is retrieve the Demon Orders.
I'm nervous. Especially about the fact that Marnox is so quiet...{nl}I'm sure that he's planning something behind the scenes.
I'm wounded myself...{nl}But I'm more worried about the condition the other priests are in.{nl}
I brought some potions and bandages in case something like this happened...{nl}But I had to leave them behind since we were chased by the demons.{nl}
I know it's a lot to ask, but you're the only one that can help.{nl}Could you find my medicine bags so I can cure the other priests?
The wounds of the other priests are severe, including Priest Irma.{nl}I brought potions and bandages just in case, but since we were chased by demons...{nl}
I am reluctant to ask the Revelator who has done so much but...{nl}Could you find my medicine bags so I can cure the other priests?
I know it is blasphemous, but I had always had my doubts about the Revelator.{nl}But you've defeated Marnox, who all of the priests together couldn't handle.{nl}
Now I know.{nl}Only you, who has been sent by the goddesses can really save the world...
Thank you so much for saving my colleagues.{nl}You ran in even though you knew that there were demons...
Hmm... Rose is really late.{nl}Should we wait a little bit more?
Not all priests can heal by miraculous powers.{nl}We have to put a stick next to the broken part and get medicine for the injury.
I do feel uncomfortable for the words I have used.{nl}Rose is still out and I am a bit worried.
What happened to the people of the Croa Village?{nl}And why are there demons here?
The last time I have visited here, there was no sight of a demon.. {nl}I am worried something awful has happened.{nl}Have you heard anything about this situation?
Thank you for getting me my missing bag.{nl}Right after I heal myself I have to go to the other priests.
Rose is late... far too late.{nl}They say no news is good news, but this is not the time.{nl}What should we do?
Has Tess been chased by the demons just like other people?{nl}I have no idea what happened here.
All the idols that can be destroyed have been destroyed but it was a rushed job...{nl}I am still hung up about the fragments left behind.
The fragments could come back to bite us in the back, if not its energy remains.{nl}I am terribly sorry about this but could you take care of the remaining pieces?
I am grateful for your kindness.{nl}Wait for a second for I will give you a piece of cloth soaked with Holy Water.
Cover the Idol Fragments with this Holy Water Cloth and it will be purified.
One less thing to worry about.{nl}Restoring this place will not be an easy task.
Along with the bishop, we destroyed all the idols we could get our hands on {nl}while on the run from Marnox's chase.
If you don't deal with the fragments, its malicious energy will come back to haunt us again.{nl}I'm sure you must be tired and weary on this journey, {nl}but could we ask for an undeserved request?
First, show me what you got.{nl}I guess, defeating Red Kepas and Woodins, 10 each at the Paupys Crossing would suffice.
It's heart-wrenching to see those who have fled their home to here.{nl}If only they learnt the ways of the Highlander's sword.
I, as the Highlander Submaster, am helping the immigrants the best I can...{nl}I am worried if the migration orders aren't a big burden to the lord.
Are you the one willing to walk the path of a Highlander?{nl}A test awaits you.{nl}
Those without the necessary talents should waste no breath.{nl}
The main weapon of a Highlander is a two-handed sword.{nl}It's a powerful weapon but it does require great strength to wield one.{nl}
Now try to attack the sword pell nearby.{nl}I will see how strong you are.
Now try to attack the sword pell nearby.{nl}And I will make the call.
Hmm... You're a bit lacking.{nl}A further test is in order.
But your strength itself is quite impressive, to be honest.{nl}But mere brute force is not enough. The finesse is the key to handle it.
Defeating Woodins at Paupys Crossing, for you, would not be too much to ask, would it?{nl}Defeat them and I will let you in.
It's not that difficult as a test.{nl}If you can handle your own strength, that is.
You look like someone who will not tarnish the name of Highlander.{nl}My father, also a Highlander, before me will say the same.
I, on behalf of my master, will teach you the path of the Highlander.
Do you desire to become a Peltasta?{nl}You made a wise choice.
We, Peltastas, have to know the way to utilize our shields properly to fend off enemies.{nl}Therefore, the basic understanding of a shield is a prerequisite.
I want you to get me some materials to make a shield.{nl}If you can do this, I will consider worthy enough to be a Peltasta.
Defeat Pokuborns in the Woods of the Linked Bridges and retrieve Pokuborn Tusks.{nl}Oh, and one more thing...{nl}
Get me some dry wood from the abandoned workshop at the Paupys Crossing.{nl}It belonged to our trading partner but it went out of business. {nl}The owner did say we can take as much as we please.
Learn the structure of a shield to utilize it efficiently.{nl}I'll wait for your return.
Ah, those who aim to become a Peltasta never disappoint me.{nl}You're done, congratulations on becoming one of us.
We always welcome a new brethren.{nl}Could we ask you to help the people here?
The monsters in the Woods of the Linked Bridges are causing terrors to the nearby village.{nl}I would have gone myself but...{nl}
The masters in Klaipeda insisted that I should not leave Orsha.{nl}So, if you want to prove your worth, this is your chance.
Don't think of it only as a mission...{nl}But think of it as punishment on those monsters terrorising the people.
The road to giving yourself up to the goddess is a noble one. {nl}I commend you for choosing this path.{nl}However, a test to see if you can become a Krivis.
Good. This test is quite simple.{nl}But first, take this Torch Gem.{nl}
This gem will absorb the life force of a monster and store it as its energy.{nl}Fill this gem with the vitality of the monsters and come back to me.{nl}
Once the gem is filled with energy. Use it on the flameholder besides me.{nl}What I am looking for is how well can you handle the energy of Torch's power.
Let's recap. Defeat the monster and fill the gem up.{nl}Use the energy to light the flameholder beside me.
Your determined eyes do tell me that you are seeking the way of Priesthood.{nl}I can clearly see not only the will but the talent.
However... A bit of preparation is needed.{nl}To prepare for the journey to completely give yourself up to the goddess.
Take this Holy Water.{nl}Ask the other Cleric Masters for their blessings.{nl}
One each from the Cleric, Krivis and Bokor Submasters.
Please, do seek the blessings from the Cleric, Krivis and Bokor Submasters in Orsha.
Good. The blessings from the ensure your rightful path.{nl}Please, take the duty and responsibility of being a Priest earnestly.
Hmm, you look for a step forward into something higher?{nl}Seeking power is a rough journey.{nl}
But does your pounding heart command you still?
Very well. I take that as yes.{nl}Sweep the Gosarus in the Dadan Jungle.
Ten-odd Gosarus won't cut it.
You talk the talk and walk the walk.{nl}I, on behalf of my master, will hand you all the skills of a Swordsman.
I want to see how much you have trained yourself as a Highlander.{nl}The Gosarus in the Dadan Jungle would serve quite nicely.{nl}
Training comes later.
The goal is simple.{nl}Sweep the Gosarus in the Dadan Jungle.
Impressive.{nl}I will keep my end of the bargain to teach you more advanced skills of a Highlander.
Before we commence, testing whether you can go through the training or not would be in order.{nl}
Now, let me give you this counter. Use it while defeating monsters.{nl}As you defeat them, the number will go up.{nl}
Oh, it won't count if you do it without equipping a shield.{nl}I'll count it as double if you defeat a demon.{nl}
Just remember... You'll have to start from the beginning if you become incapacitated.{nl}I will not accept any results that come from working with colleagues.{nl}
Do you understand?{nl}Well then, good luck.
It'll be worth testing only if you use a shield, don't you think?{nl}Don't forget that dealing with demons is more efficient.
I think that you've proven that you are worthy of saying that you are a Peltasta.{nl}As promised, I'll teach you more advanced skills.
Hoplites use shields and spears. {nl}There is a great difference from using a sword.{nl}
I wish to test if being a Hoplite suits you.{nl}As it happens, there is a good place to test volunteers like you.
Deal with the Raffly in Dadan Jungle.{nl}I'll acknowledge the fact that you are skilled enough to handle a spear if you pass the test.{nl}
I think that you'll have no trouble in passing the test.
If you have trouble dealing with Raffly, you may want to consider an alternate career path.
The spear is a weapon that is easy to use, but difficult to master.{nl}I hope that you will keep this in mind.
The giant tree was a terrible catastrophe. {nl}The same goes to the monsters. I admit that.{nl}
But the excessive chaos that followed was on the hands of the leaders.{nl}If Medzio Diena had happened where I came from, it would not have come to this.
I see some people like you who wish to settle down this chaos.{nl}That's one of the few strengths of this kingdom.
You want to become a Barbarian? {nl}As a weakling from these parts, do you think that you have what it takes?{nl}
Good. I'll give you a simple task to see if you can at least imitate combat.{nl}Even children can do this where I came from. Do you want to try?
Belligerence is the most important virtue of a warrior.{nl}Attack everything that is a threat to you and defend those that you wish to protect.{nl}
Go and deal with the Gosaru in Dadan Jungle before you return.
I thought you had some guts since you wanted to become a Barbarian... {nl}Are you giving up?
Did you hear the news?{nl}Some refugees on the way to Orsha have been isolated.{nl}
They are also wounded as well. {nl}Lemprasa Pond won't have any proper relief facilities either...{nl}
We must save them at once!
I shall bless the Special Orsha Ointment.{nl}Please cure the refugees with it.{nl}
I shall acknowledge you as a proper Cleric once you've helped clear this.
I am grateful that they didn't have any further troubles.{nl}It's all thanks to your quick actions.{nl}
I think that your are well prepared to go forth to the last stage of becoming a Cleric.

I think the time has come for you to prove your faith to the goddesses and receive their blessings.{nl}Worshiping the Goddess Statues is a rite of passage to reach out to the goddesses themselves.{nl}
Please make offerings to all Goddess Statues near Orsha.
Lemprasa Pond and Woods of the Linked Bridges... {nl}Not to mention the four statues at Paupys Crossing.{nl}
Don't forget to come back to me after you've made your offerings.
It is not simply a formality for votive offerings.{nl}I hope that it shall be a chance for you to repent for any past deeds in front of the goddesses.
You've done well. {nl}Did the Goddess Statue seem to have any broken parts?{nl}
I shall help you advance your skills even further.{nl}
I've been looking after the refugees at Orsha with the other priests.{nl}But... We've run out of herbs to craft ointment with.{nl}
I'll give you a small task since it is about time to test your skills.
The herbs that I need to craft the ointment are {nl}Wormwood, Hemostasis Herb, and Moonlight Flower.{nl}You can gather them at Koru Jungle, Knidos Jungle and Dadan Jungle.{nl}
Well then, I hope that you will able to help out.
I'll craft the ointment as soon as you gather the three herbs.{nl}I hope that you do not forget servitude even though it is a test of passage.
Let's see... Hmm. There seems to be no problem.{nl}You will feel your faith become stronger if you continue performing kind deeds.{nl}
You've passed the test. {nl}Please don't forget that faithfulness shall become your strength.
The Bokor...{nl}It is not a difficult path in itself, but it does require a ritual.{nl}
The initiation of becoming a Bokor starts with crafting your own doll.{nl}As the master in Klaipeda says, you cannot achieve anything without doing it yourself.
I can provide you with the recipe if you need.{nl}But you'll have to collect the neccessary ingredients by yourself.{nl}
Check your journal for details on how to craft a doll.
I've heard that not only myself, but the master also became a Bokor by crafting a doll.{nl}It is a historic and traditoinal ritual.
That is a magnificent doll.{nl}Now, you are a respectable Bokor yourself.{nl}
I pray that the goddesses shall lead you safely on the path of the Bokor...{nl}
Do you know about the owls carved from wood at Karolis Springs?{nl}They are the work of Grandfather Tesla.
The goddesses grant their blessings to statues that you put your heart into sculpting.{nl}I still have a long way to go before I catch up to Grandfather Tesla in Klaipeda...
You wish to become a Dievdirbys? {nl}I welcome you, of course. It's not that difficult.{nl}
The road to becoming a Dievdirbys is open to everyone.{nl}If... you can do me a small favor that is.
My chisel is all worn out.{nl}I think I'll have to make a request to Ilanai, the blacksmith in Orsha.{nl}
Ilanai will give you a new chisel if you say that it's a request from me.
I'm sorry. Could you make the trip to Orsha for me?{nl}I have something left to do here.
How can I help you?{nl}
Ah, I know Zenoa very well myself. {nl}You're talking about that cute Dievdirbys right?{nl}
I'm sorry, but...{nl}I don't have any chisels prepared, and I'm fresh out of materials to make new ones.
I'm sorry, is it very urgent?{nl}Hmm.. I think I might be able to help out if you bring me the ingredients.{nl}
You can obtain high quality metals from the Grummers at Dadan Jungle.{nl}I'll do it before anything else if you can get me some of those metals.
I don't know what the Grummers eat but... {nl}High quality metals form like pearls inside them.{nl}
Well, it's all good for me I suppose.
You've already brought it back?{nl}I've got the preparations ready, so it'll be done soon enough.
This time it will remain sharp for a long time since I've made it as strong as possible.{nl}Here, take this to Zenoa please.
Tell Zenoa to come by Orsha some day.{nl}That I really miss the company.
Oh dear... {nl}I thought it was taking longer than expected.{nl}
I thank you all the same.{nl}Come back any time and I'll be glad to teach you!
You've really become much better in a short period of time!{nl}I would be proud to show your skills to anybody else.{nl}
I just think that it may be a bit short to meet the standards of my father in Klaipeda.{nl}I'll help you get to a higher stage in achievements.
Good. Shall we check what you've learned so far?{nl}Defeat a monster with Highlander skills. It doesn't matter what monster you choose.{nl}
Defeating them yourself is extremely important.{nl}Without the aid of any Highlander colleagues.
Defeat monsters using Highlander skills. {nl}I think it's an easy task considering that it's the last test.
It seems as if you'll be able to learn more difficult skills with ease.{nl}I'd feel confident when telling anyone that I was the one that taught you those moves.
You'll be able to deal with most demons with your skills.{nl}But you must become a bit stronger to defeat truly powerful demons.{nl}
I shall open the road to becoming a true Peltasta.{nl}I'm sure that you'll have no trouble.
They say that a Chaparition is threatening people at Karolis Springs.{nl}I think that it will be fitting for a test of your strength.
The Chaparition should be an easy opponent considering the courage you've shown so far.{nl}Don't be too worried.
Excellent.{nl}With skills like that, I'd trust you with my back any day.{nl}
I'll report it to the master soon.{nl}I'll first teach you of the true powers of the Peltasta on my initiative.
Your growth is simply astonishing.{nl}I feel something different from the other Hoplites.{nl}
But are you satisfied with that?{nl}I think you can go for the next step.
There's a monster that I've previously faced.{nl}Sparnasman, I thought that I had him... But I lost him at the last moment.{nl}
I've heard rumors that the Sparnasman has returned.{nl}I'm sure that you'll be able to finish him in my place.{nl}
Oh, and bring the tip of my spear as evidence that you've defeated him.{nl}It should still be stuck in him.

Please defeat the Sparnasman at Novaha Annes and bring the tip of my spear back to me.{nl}{nl}It was a long time ago, but the fight... was extremely fierce.{nl}I was tired and he also had steam rising from him.{nl}
I adjusted my grip on my spear thinking that it would be the killing blow.{nl}He finally came at me.{nl}
I thought I'd properly stabbed him... But he suddenly passed me and flew away. {nl}With my spear still in him.{nl}
I've let him go.{nl}Currently, I'd be able to deal with it in a single strike but...
That is most certainly the tip of the spear I drove into it.{nl}I'll be able to brag that one of our capable Hoplites has defeated that nightmare.{nl}
Come back at any time since you've passed the test.{nl}I am also ready to teach you more.
Hmm... You seem as if you've grown stronger.{nl}You may be worthy to learn more of the way of the sword since you've trained so much.
Of course I can't simply let you know. {nl}Prove your strength first!{nl}
Dealing with monsters at Feretory Hills is your test.{nl}But it must be done without enhancements. What use would the test be it them.{nl}
Of course the help of colleagues is excluded as well.{nl}Do you get it? Prove your worth with the might of your sword alone.
Without colleagues. Without enhancements.{nl}It is a very easy and simple test.
You. You're more useful than you look.{nl}The Master will be pleased that such talent has chosen to become a Barbarian.
We Rodelero attack enemies by blocking their view with shields and going for their blind spots.{nl}I'd say that such strategies will work the better your shield is.{nl}
Since it is still the introductory stage, let's start with bringing a shield that has been enhanced 4 times.{nl}I think that's cutting you enough slack, what do you think?
You have to equip a shield that has been enhanced 4 times at the very least.{nl}How did you even think of becoming a Rodelero without that.
Good. That is enough.{nl}I now welcome you as a fellow Rodelero.
Cataphract... Not a bad choice.{nl}We bombard the enemies with attacks riding atop our companions while we charge through enemy lines.{nl}
But simply looking nice and what acutally happens is never the same.{nl}It shall be a completely different route from what you've done. Do you think you're up for it?
Then how about we test your resolve?{nl}I shall acknowledge you if you have enough determination to deal with the demons at Feretory Hills.
It is disconcerting to give you a truly difficult task if you keep requesting it after I threatened you.{nl}I think that Feretory Hills should be a suitable test for you.
Impressive. {nl}I apologize for treating you lightly on first impression.{nl}My lessons are not to be taken lightly. I hope you are determined.
The time has finally come.{nl}The Master at Klaipeda said that faithfulness is the strength of a Krivis.{nl}
The master would have asked you to prove yourself through sparring... {nl}But I wish to test your skills through servitude.{nl}
Please be cautious as this is the last test.{nl}Tell me when you are prepared.
They say that the monsters are swelling in numbers at {nl}Feretory Hills and are now threatening the people.{nl}Please purify the monsters with this gemstone.{nl}
It is not easy to purify by normal means.{nl}You'll have to tire the monsters a bit for it to have an effect.{nl}
Please bring the purified ashes to me.
I am thinking of it as a service to everyone.{nl}That seems to be fitting of a Krivis.
I ponder if such servitude is the mercy of the goddesses.{nl}Well done. Such posture shall lead you to greater stages.
You wish to continue to follow the path of the goddesses burdened as a priest.{nl}If so, you may rise to a greater stage by defeating evils in this world.
It is said that monsters at Feretory Hills are full of evil energy.{nl}Deal with them in the name of the goddess.
You've now become a respectable Bokor.{nl}I wish to forsee your future as a colleague, not as a beginner.{nl}
Please bring me the card of a powerful monster.{nl}
The master said that the cards that people choose are pre-determined...{nl}But it is beyond my ability to see what card you shall bring.
Eternal flames, a women with wounds on her back, an upturned jewel...{nl}These are about all the words that I can make out.
Its interpretation is up to you.{nl}But it seems to me as if you have a greater mission, at variance from the common person.{nl}
I shall pray for you to be able to finish your mission.
Grandfather Tesla had always emphasized the importance of materials.{nl}Not simply rare and expensive materials, but materials that you will be able to put your heart into.{nl}
I've recently had a chance to get such materials...{nl}But I simply could not get the chance to get them.{nl}
I'll teach you how to craft new statues if you bring them to me.
Look for Sparnasman in Novaha Annex.{nl}Its horns are the materials that I've been looking for so be careful please.
Grandfather Tesla said that he found them at the Crystal Mine.{nl}Those blue crystals were wonderful... but I wish to find some that suit me.
These are indeed the materials that I requested.{nl}Someday, you shall find materials that are to your liking as well.{nl}
Now, as promised, I shall teach you to craft new statues.{nl}Come back to me at any time.
The path of the Sadhu...{nl}So you seek to go down a difficult path.{nl}
Very well. Though it is hard for me to properly test you as I am currently out of body.{nl}I shall do so in my own way.
I shall give you a materialized crystal of my energy.{nl}My task is for you to deal with monsters after injecting them with my energy.{nl}
I shall purify the monster's souls that you bring me with pure energy.{nl}But, the monsters must be dealt by yourself without the help of others.
My body? It is at Akmens Ridge.{nl}You shall be able to send your spirit as far as I can once you've trained as much as I have.{nl}
But it is a stage that must be achieved... {nl}Slowly step by step through intense training.
You've done admirably even if it was a simple test.{nl}I shall look forward to your growth.{nl}{nl}
The strength to fight against the evil demons comes from one's devout faith in the goddesses.{nl}If you wish to become one of us, you must prove your strength to back up your faith.
Good. Now shall we put you to the test?{nl}Report back after you've dealt with all of the monsters at Feretory Hills.
We Paladins are always on front lines of the fight with demons.{nl}You won't be able to stay alive for long if you are not skilled even if you do have a rightous heart.
You've done better than any of my expectations.{nl}Now vow to fight for the goddesses as a paladin for your faith and justice.
Are you planning on passing through Delmore Castle?{nl}If you do, I suggest turning around immediately.{nl}
This is a place that has become a den of demons because of the lord of the castle.{nl}We have gathered here... because he is once more attempting to do the same horrible deeds.
Never... Never again shall we allow the same thing to happen.{nl}I am ashamed of myself... but if this can be any form of retribution...{nl}
This is a place that has become a den of demons because of the lord of the castle.{nl}We should have discovered the true identity of the Kruvina earlier...{nl}
Maybe if you were a Revelator...{nl}Anyway, I've warned you enough so you should return to where it's safe.
You're a Revelator as well?{nl}Hmm... If that's true...{nl}
We've gathered here to stop Delmore Rephaim, the lord of Delmore Castle.{nl}All because he's trying to create another Kruvina.{nl}
Oh, do you know about the Kruvina?{nl}The demon's plan to use the spores of death to invade Orsha...{nl}
The Kruvina crafted by Delmore Rephaim is the center piece of that plan...{nl}Which can also exhibit tremendous strength depending on how it is used.{nl}
Delmore Rephaim was once a revered lord and established alchemist...{nl}But he touched upon forbidden alchemy by conspiring with the demons. {nl}
That's how the pinnacle of demon magic and human technology was created.{nl}That creation is known as the Kruvina.
I was once a mage under Delmore Rephaim as well.{nl}But I ran after seeing him create the Kruvina, which simply made me feel sick.{nl}
I should have stopped its creation... But I was a coward back then.{nl}Delmore Rephaim is trying to build that Kruvina once more.{nl}
Such terrible events... must not be allowed to happen again.{nl}That's why we've gathered the Revelators from Klaipeda and brought them here.{nl}
I'd say the more the merrier.{nl}How about lending a hand in stopping him since you're a Revelator as well?
It's a relief to have your cooperation.{nl}Oh, we were just about to destroy the Magic Power Supply Devices {nl}supplying the Kruvina Devices with power.{nl}
The device is protected by a powerful protection spell...{nl}They've cast it on ordinary items to obscure the spell.{nl}
I'll mark the places where I predict they may be, so take this compass with you.{nl}It's a compass that reacts to magic, so I'm sure it'll react to the spells.
Delmore Rephaim had great ambitions.{nl}It would have been much better if that was merely a lust for power...
Above Amjene Sanctum and... Hmm. I see. Good job. {nl}
To sustain such an enormous magic circle, Delmore Rephaim...{nl}He placed numerous Magic Power Supply Devices {nl}around the castle as well as at the Kruvina Device.{nl}
Creating a large magic circle by oneself is simply impossible, no matter how talented you are.{nl}
Oh, I see some introductions are in order. {nl}The person next to me is Revelator Mihail.{nl}
I'm a Revelator just like you.{nl}How about talking to Mihail while I interpret the protection spells?
Impressive.{nl}I've searched for protection spell as well, but I wasn't that fast.
I couldn't believe what Melchioras was saying at first.{nl}But just look at the castle. I realized the severity of the situation soon enough.
I don't know too much about magic, but this is still the largest magic circle I've seen.{nl}You don't know what I'm talking about do you? I mean that the entire castle is a magic circle.
Greetings. Have you come from Orsha?{nl}I thought there weren't any Revelators there... We've all come from Klaipeda.{nl}
I've seen many places destroyed by the roots on Medzio Diena...{nl}But the scene here is a bit different.{nl}
It seems as if they've all been ripped off the face of the world at the same time.{nl}Not just the residents, but even all the soldiers and vassals...{nl}
Mage Melchioras seems to be taking a while to disarm the protective spell.{nl}How about we get prepared for the next move while he's at it?
It seems that we get along well.{nl}We've destroyed all the other Magic Power Supply Devices... {nl}The only one left is the one that Mage Melchioras is working on.{nl}
We have to destroy it with magic orbs when Mage Melchioras disarms the protection spell...{nl}But we don't have many left.{nl}
I'll get the detonator ready, so why don't you fill the empty orbs with magic?{nl}The orb will gather magic every time you attack Pags.
When I first arrived at Klaipeda... {nl}There were an incredible amount of Revelators gathered there.{nl}
Those people, what do you think they're doing now?
It's taking a while to interpret the protection spell cast on the Magic Power Supply Devices.{nl}Could you wait a little more until I've finished?
That was quick.{nl}It seems as if Melchioras has finished his preparations as well.{nl}
Why don't you go to Mage Melchioras?{nl}I know what's going on, but you might want some explanation seeing as you've just arrived here.
One day, the goddess appeared in my dreams telling me {nl}that I am a Revelator and that I must go to Klaipeda.{nl}Saying that only Revelators can save the world...{nl}
At first, I was at a loss of what to do, and I was here before I knew it.{nl} Then, it came to me.{nl}
The fact that... Everything I did was linked to saving the goddesses and the world.{nl}Perhaps the goddesses sent so many Revelators for that same reason?
I've finished interpretating the protection spell cast on the Magic Power Supply Devices.{nl}We'll need your help in order to get the job done in a hurry.
I'll give you this amulet.{nl}The protection spell will be disarmed when you put it on the enchanted object.{nl}
You take care of the protection spell above Amjene Sanctum.{nl}Mihail and I will take care of the rest.
We won't have to come back here if we destroy the last Magic Power Supply Device.{nl}It won't take too long to stop the entire Kruvina Device either.
There were many mages under the command of Delmore Rephaim just like me.{nl}We were all in charge of separate specializations so interpretating this will take a while.{nl}
I was in charge of the core of the Kruvina device.{nl} I thought that there was something wrong...
I was in charge of the core of the Kruvina device.{nl}I thought that there was something wrong...{nl}
You've done well. {nl}All we have to do is destroy the Magic Power Supply Device since the protective spells are gone.
The rest of the protective spells have been taken care of.{nl}Now it's my turn.{nl}
I'm sure you've heard of the orbs from Mihail.{nl}Please set them around the Magic Power Supply Device at Ishinti Crossroads.{nl}
Please go to Mihail as soon as the orbs are in place.{nl}He'll detonate the orbs.
It's strange how well everything seems to be going.{nl}I'm sure that Delmore Rephaim is creating the Kruvina somewhere...
I've tuned it so that the device will be destroyed with the smallest explosion possible...{nl}But run away from the orbs just in case you don't get caught in the explosion.
Demolitions are my speciality.{nl}Destroying a device like that is nothing as long as I get to plant the explosives right.
Please let Mihail know that the orbs are ready.{nl}I hope everything goes as planned...
It's a success!{nl}Both you and Mihail did a great job.{nl}
The Kruvina device will soon stop since all of the {nl}Magic Power Supply Devices have been destroyed.{nl}The protective shield will disappear as well.{nl}
We cannot simply relax because the device has stopped.{nl}We must destroy it so that they can never think of creating the Kruvina ever again.{nl}
Come to Delmore Manor where the device is.{nl}I'll be waiting there.
Follower Andrea
I hoped it would be migration suggestions... But somehow I don't think it is.{nl}Where are all the soldiers and vassals, not to mention the residents?
We're helping the Revelators from behind the scenes.{nl}But we never knew there would be so many demons...
This place... is terrible.{nl}I've seen many ruins but, this place seems to be on a league of its own.{nl}
Ah, I may not be a Revelator... But I volunteered to help.{nl}I'm trying to collect information on demons, but it seems as if I took it too lightly.{nl}
Oh, would you be okay in doing so?{nl}If so, I won't say no.{nl}
I've collected all the other information... but I need some about the Pag Ampler.{nl}Just tell me how you've dealt with them after defeating them.{nl}
You could tell us now if you already know enough.{nl}
We're trying to lessen the burden when the Revelators are dealing with demons.{nl}Please do your best to collect information even if it is a bit tiresome.
You've been a big help.{nl}I'm going to have to tell the other Revelators about your deeds when I'm explaining to the others.
Before I came here, I was asked a favor from a person {nl}who said that they had relatives in Delmore Castle.{nl}They asked me to give their regards since they'd lost contact for a while.{nl}
But... As you can see...{nl}Who knew this would have happened...{nl}
I was trying to give him the remaining pages of the diary...{nl}But I wasn't able to make the time because things kept coming up.
Thank you so much.{nl}He says his name is Ardel and he lived at the Old Bazaar Site.
I've heard snippets of information on the Delmore Castle.{nl}But I don't know how it became like this. Melchioras keeps saving his breath...
I don't know how to thank you.{nl}I'll remember to hand this back to you if we manage to get back.
Follower Nuodas
What do you have to do to make that many people disappear?{nl}It is creepy how all the household belongings and other things are left as they are.
I've heard many stories of losing hometowns because of monsters or demons after Medzio Diena.{nl}But this is different. It seems as if something was ripped out of the castle whole...
This was the next most thriving castle after Orsha.{nl}But the fact that such a place could become like this in an instant...{nl}
It's unfortunate what happened to the missing people, but there is nothing we can do.{nl}All we can do is to keep getting rid of those accursed demons.
How about helping out?{nl}I think that's one way of comforting the people that used to live here.
Thank you.{nl}Could you deal with the demons nearby please?
I feel terrible.{nl}Only a year ago, it was still pretty intact despite Medzio Diena.{nl}
But now...{nl}Maybe where we live isn't safe anymore either.
I hope that this will comfort them a little.{nl}There are still many demons, but we will be able to defeat all of them one day.
I felt as if the Revelator and the followers pulled their weight.{nl}Their archery skill was quite impressive.{nl}
But as a fletcher, I think that they waste too many arrows...{nl}They don't think of aiming for the weak spots and just pour arrows into a single demon.{nl}
There are more than a few Charcoal Walkers wondering about with usable arrows.{nl}Could you gather those arrows after dealing with those demons?
The more the world is in chaos, the more thrifty you should be.{nl}Please, I ask of you.
There are many followers besides me that are helping you.{nl}Please help them if you see them and don't just pass by.
There is now way I am wrong. I've designed it after all...{nl}If there is even a faint chance of that, I can only imagine that there is a new magic circle.
Making a Magic Power Supply Device Kruvina is impossible.{nl}I am sure that there is another Supply Device hidden somewhere forming another magic circle.
Oh... Did you see it all?{nl}It's all my fault.{nl}
Delmore Rephaim is not a shabby person...{nl}Even Revelator Mihail received the same treatment because of me.{nl}
We can't just give up like this.{nl}Somehow we have to find a way to neutralize the Magic Power Supply Device!
It's true that Melchioras made a mistake, but Yane was too rash this time.{nl}It would be fine if Yane has a good solution... but this doesn't feel good.
There are always followers of Yane gathering near her.{nl}Yane is determined and reliable... But is also hasty.
Thinking that it would be the same situation as when I ran was a mistake.{nl}I'm sure that there's a hidden Magic Power Supply Device somewhere.{nl}
You... There is something else I wish to ask of you.
If my calculations are correct, it should be somewhere in the Rampart Reconstruction District...{nl}Head over there with this crystal.{nl}
You'll be able to find the Magic Power Supply Device when you put this crystal on the floor.{nl}I'll be notified when one is discovered and send Revelator Mihail to take care of it.
There will be no second mistake.{nl}I'm positive that my calculations are correct.
There is a need to divide tasks in order to get things done in a hurry.{nl}I'll take care of the Magic Power Supply Device when you find them.
Revelator Mihail has gone to take care of the Magic Power Supply Device.{nl}But... There seems to be a few new Supply Devices...
Evil energy is continuing to flow in... near the Buried Central Plaza.{nl}I didn't sense it a while ago, but why...{nl}
Take theses jewels please.{nl}I am a bit suspicious but there is just no other way.
I know it may sound like an excuse... But it's just too strange.{nl}There's no way I am wrong...
I think things are going in a bad direction.{nl}I... I'm sorry. I'll keep concentrating.
So there was no Magic Power Supply Device, only a horde of monsters?{nl}That's odd... I'm sorry.{nl}
I must have been a little confused earlier.{nl}Next time I'll try to pay more attention so I don't give you any wrong information.
This time I'm sure.{nl}Please... Will you go to the Handicraft Workshop once again?
What?{nl}You say Yane found a new way to do it?{nl}
How does that even...{nl}Can you share any more details?
She found it in Delmore Rephaim's document...?{nl}What kind of person writes down the way to destroy their own device?{nl}
This has to be a trap.{nl}We need to stop Yane before it's too late!{nl}
So everyone gathers around the device and attacks at the same time?{nl}Are you sure...? I really don't think that's the way to destroy it!{nl}
Now I know. I realize what went wrong...{nl}Delmore Rephaim was watching us all the entire time!{nl}
Whatever we do we can't gather by the device!{nl}We need to stop Yane, quick!{nl}
This Kruvina... it's made using human lives!
Melchioras, did you say... human lives?{nl}Oh no, we need to do something!{nl}
I'll go first and try to talk to her.{nl}You and Melchioras, come with me!
If the device is activated, the Revelators will all turn into Kruvina!{nl}We need to go to Palma Central Plaza right now and stop Yane!{nl}
You're... the one who helped Melchioras.{nl}I really don't know what to say to him...{nl}
I should have believed him right away...{nl}But I guess I was too greedy...{nl}
I don't know if he'll ever accept my apologies...{nl}But rescuing him is the least I can do to try and redeem myself.
I also thought at first that Melchioras was leading us into a trap...{nl}I really don't know how I'll ever be able to face him now.{nl}
We should set up a base camp to help Melchioras heal.{nl}That way he'll be safe when he comes back... Let's hope he does...{nl}
Everything else is fine, but the barricade is going to be a problem.{nl}There aren't enough materials around to build one, {nl}and we can't tear down another barricade to make our own...{nl}
And after the Kruvina device, my condition isn't the best either...{nl}If that's okay with you, will you help us set up the barricade?
I think I saw some crates on the way to the Handicraft Workshop and on the Kalbos Vacant Lot.{nl}Try and find some wooden boards there.
It's hard to believe, honestly.{nl}We barely managed to destroy the Magic Power Supply Device, but if that was all in vain...{nl}
But the fact is, this was our fault.{nl}How are we ever going to face Melchioras again...
Wow, that's... Thank you so much.{nl}I should go and pray to the goddesses for Melchioras to come back safe and sound.
Thanks to Melchioras I'm alive...{nl}I feel so sorry to him, but all I can do now is prepare for{nl}his return so we can nurse him back to health in safety...{nl}
There are way too many demons!{nl}And my condition isn't really... Will you please help me?
If I knew what kind of place this was I would've thought twice about coming.{nl}But Melchioras... he came back here knowing what this was.
Everyone feels so sorry for Melchioras.{nl}I don't even know how to apologize to him...{nl}
You're... close to Melchioras, right?{nl}It would be great if you could let him know we're sorry...
Follower Wedge
When the magic circle was activated it felt as if a hand was pulling on my spirit.{nl}Not an experience I'd like to repeat.
I knew this would happen.{nl}If Melchioras was really trying to trick us he would've taken us to the device right away.{nl}
I'm going to make some medicine for when Melchioras returns...{nl}Would you please give me a hand?
There's a type of mushroom called Thorn Mushroom.{nl}It helps people with serious injuries regain their health.{nl}
They're the only type of mushroom that grows on the Kalbos Vacant Lot {nl}and the Buried Central Plaza...{nl}I'm sure they'll be easy to find.{nl}
If Melchioras doesn't make it...{nl}I can hardly imagine how guilty we'll feel, not just Yane but all of us.
Everyone was really unfair to Melchioras.{nl}I have no excuse either. I should have listened to him...{nl}
Anyway, thanks for the mushrooms.{nl}I hope I get to give this medicine to Melchioras.
Melchioras is truly an honorable man.{nl}He did after all sacrifice himself for the people who vilified him.{nl}
We have many injured, and there's monsters and demons everywhere.{nl}If we can't wipe them all out, our best bet is to chase away the monsters as much as we can.{nl}
I'm sorry, but could you collect some Charog sap?{nl}I want to make a monster repellant.
The people who lived here... they must have all been turned into Kruvina.{nl}I wish Melchioras had told us everything from the beginning...
It's time to roll up our sleeves now.{nl}There is something we used to do in my hometown, {nl}except we had demons there, not monsters...
I think Delmore Rephaim is planning to use Melchioras as a shield.{nl}We should hurry.
I'm mostly worried about Melchioras.{nl}Delmore Rephaim... if we leave him be he's just going to try and make another Kruvina.
Revelator Connor
Delmore Rephaim...{nl}Seeing how he made the Kruvina, he's not someone we should underestimate.
Everyone is... in their worst condition...{nl}But we're willing to do anything to rescue Melchioras and stop Delmore Rephaim.{nl}
The crossroads start here. I think it's best if we split into groups and surround him.{nl}He'll be more intimidated once he realizes he has nowhere to escape.{nl}
Connor and I will head to Tagika Crossroads.{nl}You and Mihail take the Outskirts Central Plaza.
He may be on the run, but don't forget Delmore Rephaim is a talented alchemist.{nl}Not to mention he can be very persuasive.{nl}
We don't know what kind of trap he has prepared, so be very careful.
We're getting closer to him on both sides of the crossroads.{nl}He'll be more intimidated once he realizes he has nowhere to escape.
Mihail is waiting.{nl}Are you ready yet?
I pray for the chance to redeem myself...{nl}May the goddesses protect Melchioras...
You take the bottom area.{nl}If one side fails, the other needs to step up and support right away.
That was a really tough enchantment.{nl}I wonder how Yane did in Tagika Crossroads...
I... I feel completely sick to my stomach.{nl}My whole body feels terrible after being around that Kruvina device.{nl}
And Yane... She's too proud to admit she was affected...{nl}But she was close to the device, she probably has it way worse than me.{nl}
I'm worried she may have already got to Delmore Rephaim.{nl}Let's go down and find her.{nl}{nl}
Thank you for your help.{nl}I could've done more if only my condition was better...{nl}
We saw a strange light on the way to a street near the ruins.{nl}We ran to it but we got caught up in the enchantment.{nl}Connor's injuries seem worse than mine, he should rest here.
I could've done more if only my condition was better... Clearly I need to train more.{nl}Let's go. I saw a strange light by a street near the ruins.
I'm already exhausted, but I can't stop.{nl}Rescuing Melchioras is more important than my condition right now.
To think he set up all these enchantments in the short time he ran away...{nl}Do we even have a chance to catch up to Delmore Rephaim?
A light in Government Ruins...{nl}It feels odd somehow. What if something happened...
That lousy enchantment...{nl}We shouldn't be wasting time here...{nl}
I... I think my injuries are too serious.{nl}You'll have to fight Delmore Rephaim on my behalf...
Everyone else should move now.{nl}It's just over the obstacle. Are you ready?
This altar...{nl}It's just another one of Delmore Rephaim's dirty tricks.{nl}
The altar is absorbing Melchioras' spirit.{nl}He did this because he knew we weren't just going to let it happen.
I can't be stubborn anymore.{nl}Everything that happened was because of me...
I'll take care of Melchioras, you go and chase Delmore Rephaim.{nl}And please... come back safely.
Fortunately Melchioras is still breathing.{nl}It could have been worse had we arrived later.
To think he resorted to something so low...{nl}It's getting late. We should hurry now.
I'm a Sadhu now, but I used to train with the Bokor Master.{nl}I made a shaman doll back then, if only I could put that in Melchioras' place right now...{nl}
It's not impossible, though.{nl}Let me give you my shaman doll; defeat some demons and collect their spirits here.{nl}
When you become a Bokor you start by making your own shaman doll.{nl}I just never thought I'd be using mine to save a life...
Yane's suggestion sounds dangerous, but... I think we have no choice.{nl}I say we try that first while I try and think of other solutions.
Thank you for saving me but...{nl}Right now you need to focus on... Delmore Rephaim...{nl}
Hurry and find him... He's at the Odaginkas Vacant Lot...{nl}You have to stop him...
I'm... losing my senses now...{nl}I'm sorry... for keeping you behind.
Yane, stop being stubborn and take care of Melchioras.{nl}You're in worse condition than all of us, you should stay.{nl}
We're lagging behind.{nl}Let's hurry and head to the Odaginkas Vacant Lot!{nl}
It's over!{nl}
What happened to Delmore Rephaim?{nl}What was all that light and the ground shaking...?{nl}
Is that so...? So he had the end he deserved.{nl}I just don't know if this can appease all the Delmore Castle {nl}residents that are now with the goddess.
Delmore Rephaim is gone but... I'm still worried about Melchioras.{nl}Shall we go back now?
What... what happened to Delmore Rephaim?{nl}
I see...{nl}I guess it went as expected from him then...{nl}
Right before he escaped he seemed almost addicted to forbidden knowledge, you see.{nl}As if there was nothing that could stop him...{nl}
And I followed him, knowing full well he was an ally of the demons.{nl}But there was no match for his character, his thirst for knowledge.{nl}
When I found out he was going to use the people of Delmore Castle to make the Kruvina...{nl}Yes, had I been able to stop him then, everyone would have been saved...{nl}
The reason I gathered the Revelators and came back here...{nl}Wasn't just to clear my conscience for not saving all those people.{nl}
The Kruvina spore plan was going to happen at the Pelke Shrine Ruins...{nl}The rest of the spirits must have been sent to Letas Stream to be offered to the Divine Tree.{nl}
The Kruvina is capable of much more horrendous deeds...{nl}Now the demons are going to try and create an even stronger one.{nl}
The new Kruvina won't use humans, but a source of sacred power...{nl}The goddesses.{nl}
That's why they have to be stopped. I didn't realize it at first but...{nl}I feel in you a power that is different from other Revelators.{nl}
The only hope I have left is on you.{nl}Please, go to Seir Rainforest... put a stop to the demons' plans.
Melchioras has managed to regain his consciousness.{nl}Was it the work of the goddesses...? I'm so glad he's alive...
Melchioras regained his consciousness while we were fighting, it seems.{nl}I'm glad everything is going to be alright now. I really am.
Melchioras was asking for you the whole time.{nl}I don't even know what to say, I'm so glad everything ended well...
I hoped I could be the one to catch Delmore Rephaim...{nl}But I'm glad it turned out well. If only I wasn't hurt...
Chasing away the demons, rebuilding the walls...{nl}I wonder how long it will take to make Delmore Castle a place worth living again.
The demons are going to try and make an even stronger Kruvina.{nl}The new Kruvina won't run on humans, but on a source of divine power... the goddesses.{nl}
I... I feel in you a power that's different from other Revelators.{nl}It makes me wonder if meeting you wasn't in fact the destiny granted to me by the goddesses...{nl}
I think I might stay here for a while and repent.{nl}I just don't think I'll be able to move around much...{nl}
Something is worrying me...{nl}You see, I didn't just make one Kruvina device. There were more.{nl}
They may be unfinished, but those devices are still out there.{nl}I was wondering if you could help me destroy them.
Defeat some demons and collect their demonic power in this crystal.{nl}Once the crystal is full, insert it in the device. {nl}Its magic will collide with that of the device and destroy it.{nl}
Using the crystal depletes its magic, however, so you will have to fill it up again...{nl}
When we were designing the Kruvina device...{nl}I had no idea it would be consuming the lives of the residents of Delmore Castle.{nl}
This was all due to my negligence.
Kruvina...{nl}I can never forgive myself for what happened...
What worries me, though...{nl}Do you remember?{nl}
We didn't completely destroy the Magic Power Supply Device at Delmore Manor.{nl}I'm not trying to blame Yane, but we need to do something.
We'll do it the same way as before.{nl}Defeat the demons and collect their power in the crystal.{nl}
Use the crystal on the Magic Power Supply Device to destroy it.
I'm really not trying to blame Yane but...{nl}I just want to make sure we do things right.
Thank you... so much.{nl}It should be impossible to create another Kruvina now.{nl}
I can't rid myself of my sins, nor can I take them back.{nl}All I can do is stay here and continue to repent.
Nothing guarantees there won't be another person like Delmore Rephaim in the future.{nl}Still, it's a pity what happened to Delmore Castle...
Thank you so much for rescuing Melchioras.{nl}I don't know what would be the consequence of this guilt if he hadn't made it...
Thank you so much for rescuing Melchioras.{nl}I would not be able to handle the guilt if he hadn't made it...
I know this was all the work of Delmore Rephaim but...{nl}Without help from the demons it would have been impossible.{nl}
The only way is to nip the evil in the bud and destroy them all...{nl}But how? I can barely stand up right now.{nl}
Would you please help me and clear out a few Pags?
Monsters are a threat too, but not as much as demons.{nl}Still, I believe the day will come when all demons are eradicated from this land.
I, too, did Melchioras wrong.{nl}I want to stay and help him for a little longer.{nl}
I have nothing but gratitude for you.{nl}I will pray to the goddesses, that they may protect your every step.
I met quite a lot of Revelators in Klaipeda.{nl}I don't know how to explain this feeling but... you're different, that's for sure.{nl}
Say what you will, but it was thanks to you that this all came to an end.{nl}I wonder if you're not on a different, more important mission than the rest of us...{nl}It's just what I think.{nl}
Yane may have commited a serious mistake, but she's still my ally.{nl}I'm going to stay here with her for a while and help Melchioras.
Melchioras is safe now...{nl}And thanks to you, Delmore Rephaim was defeated, too. I'm glad it's all over.{nl}
The problem now are the demons... They never seem to go away.{nl}Black Maizes are even carrying around magic amplifiers.{nl}
Those amplifiers have given us a lot of trouble, {nl}but as a Sapper I can't help but take an interest in them.{nl}Would you collect some for me?{nl}
It's hard to tell which ones have amplifiers.{nl}Just try and fight any Black Maizes that stand out to you.
The demons here seem more... should I say human?{nl}I think they might have shared some techniques with Delmore Rephaim.
Oh, thank you.{nl}I should be able to tweak this and make a more powerful bomb.
I heard the Order of the Tree of Truth had been blessed by the goddesses...{nl}But there's nothing but ghosts and monsters.{nl}
If you're staying in this graveyard, would you help me with something?{nl}I can't fight these ghosts, and the monsters come running in{nl}whenever they hear the sound of a prayer.{nl}
Would you take care of the monsters at the entrance?{nl}Meanwhile I'm going to pray and ask that the goddesses be found.
Oh, you're back.{nl}Thanks to you my prayer wasn't disturbed by the monsters.{nl}
But the dead have started to come back to life after they've come here.{nl}There can be no greater insult if it was done on purpose!{nl}
I got hurt earlier while running away from the ghosts and it's hard to move around.{nl}Would you help me with something?
Maybe because of Margiris' divine power...{nl}Sometimes the followers in Seima Stone Chamber do come back from the dead.{nl}
The followers who come back can't forget the regrets they had in life and wander here.{nl}Use this flint and grant them eternal peace.
Thank you for your help so far.{nl}By the way, the spirit rock you filled up earlier... please take this to Margiris.{nl}
Margiris is on the way to Carlyle's Mausoleum.{nl}With the spirit rock you should have no problems in joining our Order.{nl}
Who are you?{nl}Oh, that's the spirit rock I gave Gintas.{nl}
I'm getting better now, I should be able to move again if I just rest for a while.{nl}Take care and see you again some time.
The spirit rock seems to have calmed down those hideous things.{nl}Clearly the spirits of those who rest here want them gone.{nl}
Now we must imprint the aura to defile the graveyard into the spell doll.{nl}There were some black crystals that I hadn't seen before where we burned the dead.{nl}
Are you the Revelator Leja talked about?{nl}And that's... our food that got stolen.{nl}
Like I said earlier, we can't trust you just yet.{nl}
There is a totem that we don't even dare get close to because of its evil energy.{nl}If you really are a Revelator, then you should be able to destroy it with your divine power.{nl}
Show us.{nl}If you really are a Revelator, that is...
You... you're a true Revelator, there's no doubt about it.{nl}I feel so sorry for how I treated you earlier... Please forgive this old man.{nl}
Medzio Diena didn't cause much damage here, but that was only the beginning.{nl}You see, not long ago our river turned red.{nl}
Hurry and follow the light.{nl}This can only be a sign sent by Goddess Laima to guide you in the right direction.{nl}
Ah... And we can't let them know in Fedimian...{nl}We're in a really tough spot.{nl}
The totem is at the Banaga Forest Trail.
If you really are a Revelator that came here with the light to save our town...{nl}Then you should be able to take back the ferrets' hideout.{nl}
If you can prove that you are in fact a Revelator, I will tell you where to find Leja.
Just a moment.{nl}I'll give it to you right away.
Zaura is making something evil called Kruvina using Goddess Lada's vital force.{nl}The same Kruvina the people of Delmore Castle were sacrificed to make.{nl}
Would you spread this scent around the Bellai Forest Workshop?{nl}It smells a bit... foul, but please do me this favor.
Not the lives of people... Hers. The goddess' life.{nl}That's why such a large amount of water contaminated by the Kruvina was needed.{nl}
The amount of scent I made is only enough for about three uses.{nl}Make sure you only use it when it's absolutely necessary.
Help...? It's not something I haven't thought about.{nl}The city closest to here is Fedimian.{nl}
I heard Fedimian was devastated after Medzio Diena, though.{nl}Even after four years, it's still being reconstructed.{nl}
And Goddess Lada, she said that no matter what happens to her...{nl}She would never make her presence known to anyone but the Revelators.{nl}
As you know...{nl}People now think that the goddesses have all disappeared.{nl}
But if they find out that the goddesses are still around...{nl}You can imagine what a shock that would be.{nl}
That's why only you, a Revelator, can save Goddess Lada.{nl}The goddess said so herself, too...{nl}
We want to ask for help, too. We want it more than anyone.{nl}Be it Orsha... or Fedimian, which is closer... But that's just something we can't do.{nl}
Orsha is too far away, and Fedimian is still recovering from Medzio Diena.{nl}Besides... that's not what Goddess Lada wants.{nl}
She thinks that people will be too confused if they find out about her.{nl}I don't know why that would be so confusing, but if she says so, we must follow her will.{nl}
Ow, ouch...{nl}Those darned ferrets have some sharp nails...
Our village doesn't usually welcome outsiders...{nl}It's best if you don't expect much kindness from people here.
Your face doesn't look familiar...{nl}Please don't cause a commotion and just move along.
The Story of Karolis Vol. 2

Karolis, on his way to find a place to set up Tesla's owl sculptures, came across a forest that seemed to gather evil energy.{nl}He began to wonder whether he could do something about it himself, when a girl came to him.{nl}

The girl merely spoke, but somehow Karolis seemed to understand her.{nl}And so, like the girl instructed him, Karolis built a number of altars throughout the forest and stopped the evil energy from spreading.{nl}

The Demon Lord, as expected, could not let him get away with that.{nl}He called on his demons to destroy the altars and set out to look for Karolis.{nl}Karolis took Sequoia and try to resist to the best of his strength, but it was useless.{nl}The Demon Lord was that much more powerful.{nl}
Eventually even the Sequoia that he so dearly protected was contaminated with evil energy, as Karolis and the girl saw themselves surrounded more and more closely by the demons.
I'm sorry I doubted you.{nl}It's just that our town has been hurt by fake Revelators before...{nl}
Goddess Lada being taken by the demons...{nl}None of that would have happened if we hadn't believed the fake Revelators.{nl}
And with our water turning red we felt more and more powerless...{nl}We should have realized our mistake and gone to the real Revelators, but...{nl}I'm so sorry.
What are you still doing here?{nl}You're going to miss the girl. Hurry and go after her.
Who are you? I've never seen you before...{nl}Our men are too tired. If you have no business here, would you mind not bothering us?
So you're a Revelator, like the ones in the legends?{nl}Wow... I really didn't know!
Want to go see the ferrets? They love meat jerky.{nl}It must be dangerous, but I'm curious...
Who are you? Is this your first time here?{nl}Did you get permission from my grandfather?
A real Revelator... I heard about you from the village priest.{nl}He says he was in danger and you came to save him with a light?{nl}
That light... I want to see it too!
Oh... So the ferrets became more aggressive after the statue was set up?{nl}
Maybe it's because the statue is not completed yet...{nl}I feel so sorry for bothering Widas now...
I'm sorry but... if you have no business here, you better leave now.{nl}The atmosphere in the village isn't good...
I saw it. The bright glowing light that came with you.{nl}If it wasn't for that I would have been attacked by the ferrets.{nl}
But who was that girl, I wonder...?
If you're done here I think you should go.{nl}This village is done anyways...
I almost made another big mistake, didn't I?{nl}I'm sorry. All of these tragedies happening in our village have really ruined our mood.{nl}
We were worried about the river turning red...{nl}Then a demon disguised as a Revelator... It was my fault for not realizing...{nl}
Because of the demon Goddess Lada was taken away, {nl}and our people didn't have the power to do anything...{nl}I'm so sorry... I hope you will understand...{nl}
If you ever meet that demon, be careful.{nl}It knows how to act and look like a person, you can't even tell it's not human.{nl}{nl}
No... This isn't it...{nl}Hm? Stop interrupting and go away. You're distracting me.
Our village has had a really bad experience with a demon before.{nl}It came to us pretending to be a legendary Revelator.{nl}
Of course believing it was our mistake but...{nl}We never thought we'd see an actual Revelator after that.
This thing about the ferrets... It feels like when we were tricked into making that demon totem...{nl}I'll try and start over again.
Hm? Revelator, did you speak with our village chief?{nl}Let me take a look here first, you go and help the villagers.
If Zaura didn't want you and the girl to meet...{nl}Then she might just be the key to rescuing Goddess Lada.
Do you remember?{nl}What happened when you first came to help me.{nl}
If you hadn't saved me then...{nl}We wouldn't be able to save Goddess Lada either.{nl}
As you know, Laima is the goddess of fate and foresight.{nl}I believe she's the one who put you in my path.{nl}
Thank you very much.{nl}I expect this red water will have cleared out by the time you visit our village again.{nl}
Finding out Goddess Lada is safe is the best news I've heard since Medzio Diena.{nl}Seeing all the commotion with the ferrets, however, I better finish the statue soon.
Thank you so much for rescuing Goddess Lada!{nl}And our village!
I can't believe the Demon Lord was defeated! {nl}And thanks to you the ferrets aren't stealing out food anymore.{nl}Thank you so much!
Thank you. I'm so grateful to you and to Goddess Lada for having sent you.{nl}You are a blessing to our village.
Huh, an outsider? You must be new here...{nl}Those ferrets may look cute, but they'll shred your face to pieces if you're not careful.
I don't know what the demons did to those ferrets but...{nl}Seeing how they attack, avoiding a fight must be impossible, right?
Finally that Demon Lord was defeated...{nl}And Goddess Lada was rescued... Thank you.{nl}
Thanks to you now we can focus on the ferrets.{nl}I still don't know about the red water, but we'll find an answer eventually.
I know it was Goddess Laima who sent us a Revelator, but...{nl}Still, I think everything worked out even better because of you.{nl}
I'm very thankful for everything.{nl}For saving me, and for rescuing Goddess Lada too.
Now that we know Goddess Lada is safe, I want to build a shrine with the villagers.{nl}I have faith that, with the power if the goddess, our river will become clear again. It will.
I never thought everything Goddess Laima predicted would become true.{nl}The disaster happening... even the Revelator coming to save us from it.{nl}
And yet the disaster happened, and now you saved our village and Goddess Lada.{nl}I should have been the one to keep the faith when our village was down, but I didn't.{nl}
So all of that work was in vain...{nl}Thank you for making me realize that before it was too late...
Thanks to you Goddess Lada is safe.{nl}She's lost her power now but... I know she'll get it back someday.{nl}
I know you'll do well no matter what path you chose.{nl}I've seen the miracles you're capable of with my own eyes.{nl}
Goddess Laima is leading you to be the savior of the world, I can tell.{nl}May your every step receive the blessing of the goddesses...
Our savior... The future of this world depends on your journey...{nl}Now go... Follow Laima's revelations and walk the path of salvation...
Hey, you.{nl}If you're going inside the shrine, can you give me a hand?{nl}
I need to go to where the villagers are but...{nl}I don't know, there's just so many monsters here.{nl}
It was hard enough coming all the way up here.{nl}And those no-good youngsters won't even come out to help an old man.{nl}
So you left me out, is it?{nl}You think you can sort out this red water problem all by yourselves?{nl}
Who do you take the village chief for? You lousy youngsters.{nl}
Anyway, since it came to this...{nl}If your skills are okay, will you take down some monsters?{nl}
Youngsters these days don't respect their elders anymore.{nl}What can they do by themselves?{nl}
Where's the respect for the village chief?
Yes, yes.{nl}You're much better than the youngsters in our village.{nl}
Seems like you're no nobody, hey?{nl}The young ones in our village can't kill monsters that easily.
Ugh, grandpa...{nl}How many times have I told you to stay at home? It's dangerous to go out on your own...{nl}
Thank you for looking after my grandfather.{nl}I heard you're very talented, is it?{nl}Anyway, if it's you... Hm...{nl}
We live in a village down from here.{nl}The water here runs all the way down to our village, you see.{nl}
One day, our crops started to grow a lot bigger than usual.{nl}Of course the village thought it was a blessing from the goddesses but... that didn't last long.{nl}
The crops were inedible. Every single one of them.{nl}The problem wasn't the taste, but everyone who ate them ended up bedridden, it was chaos.{nl}
On top of that, all the water in the village turned red.{nl}And just like the crops... No one could drink it anymore.{nl}
Eventually some people left for Orsha, thinking the village had been cursed...{nl}Those who stayed decided to follow the river and ended up here.{nl}
But even among all of us, we have no idea what to do.{nl}People are starting to grow tired, too...{nl}
My grandfather praised you to the skies, he's really impressed by your talent.{nl}That's why I'm asking you. Please help our village.{nl}
I'm sure you'll be able to find a solution if you just use some of your power.
Thank you for being so helpful.{nl}The first thing I want to ask of you is... to investigate the Wandering Sanctuary.{nl}
Not that long ago my grandfather went out there by himself.{nl}He ended up surrounded by monsters and... It was a close call.{nl}
There were a few objects strewn around that I'd never seen before.{nl}I think my grandfather was there to investigate them.
Found something in the heap of ashes.
I know I should take you there myself, but I feel like I'll just be a burden.{nl}That day, too, all we did was get grandpa and run away from there.
You're back.{nl}Did you see anything odd?{nl}
This... looks like a diary.{nl}I'll try and save whatever parts I can make out.{nl}
Meanwhile, could you look for my grandfather? {nl}The ground trembled all of a sudden and he went with some people from the village.{nl}
I asked them not to let him go anywhere...{nl}And now they take him with them, honestly.
Huh, what do you know.{nl}I owe you another one, eh? Thank you, thank you.{nl}
But this I know for sure.{nl}Something big is happening at the Wandering Sanctuary, I tell you.
You still can't find my grandfather?{nl}Sigh... If you do find him, make sure to bring him here.
This is it, this disc.{nl}You know how the ground trembled earlier?{nl}
The disc suddenly started glowing red so I followed it all the way here.{nl}I was chased away by monsters, but I clearly saw that it was pointing to something.{nl}
I'm going to give the disc to you; will you check where it's pointing to?{nl}My friend here got hurt so we're going to head back together.
My friend got hurt trying to protect me so we should stick together.{nl}Please do me this favor.
So the disc was pointing to this red statue? {nl}Hm... I've never seen this before.{nl}
Let me take a closer look at it, then.{nl}Who knows what else I'll be able to find.{nl}
I should go to the Absenta Reservoir.{nl}I remember Modis once said that there was a group of people in black hoods headed there.{nl}
Go see my granddaughter before you come along.{nl}She said something about a diary...?
experiment succeeded...{nl}... ...{nl}... results... protecting vessel is alive...{nl}...vina's power... Reservoir... spread... contaminate...{nl}
... ...{nl}...Seir Rainforest... Novaha Mona...{nl}... ...{nl}... annihilate... ...proceed with the pla...{nl}
Sigh, it wasn't easy. This is all I was able to recover.{nl}Almost all the pages are completely burnt.{nl}
All I understand is that...{nl}Some sort of power spread throughout the reservoir.{nl}
I wonder if that's why the water turned red, but I can't be sure...{nl}The vessel is alive... This part sounds strange, too.{nl}
I have no idea about the rest.{nl}Any guesses?
Anyway, enough with the diary...{nl}You should go and follow my grandfather to the Absenta Reservoir.
You're back?{nl}Ah, my granddaughter, all she does is worry about me.{nl}
Oh, of course.{nl}Can you tell me about what was in the diary?
I saw it.{nl}Before the water turned red, there were people praying here.{nl}
Those fools in the village think it was because of something else...{nl}But I'm convinced there are goddesses we don't know about.{nl}
The goddesses must have gotten angry because no one believes them.{nl}I'm sure offering them a tribute would appease them...{nl}
So I was thinking about offering them some monster meat.{nl}Would you help me?
The crops in our village were all contaminated by the red water so we can't eat them.{nl}I can't offer that to the goddesses, right?
You got it!{nl}Thank you so much for helping me.
I'm going to make an offering and pray to this obelisk.{nl}Oh, there's another obelisk somewhere.{nl}
I'll tell you where it is so you can go and pray there, yes?{nl}If we solve this I'm sure you'll be generously rewarded by our people.
The other obelisk is on the left side of the Vishikas Great Hall.{nl}I'll stay here and pray, then. You go now.
Have I made the offering, you ask?{nl}No, I only prayed so far... Why?{nl}
What? You mean the monsters suddenly ran to the offering?{nl}Huh?... That's impossible...{nl}
I'm sure I saw those people praying.{nl}They were wearing black hoods... I really saw them...{nl}
Hm... I'm confused.{nl}That's what I told everyone, what am I going to say now...
You didn't see a young man called Napalis, did you?{nl}He went out a while ago and hasn't been back since. I'm worried about him now.{nl}
He said he was headed to the Drava Chapel Lot.{nl}If you're going that way, would you mind checking in on him?
Why did he have to go out at a time like this.{nl}I sure hope nothing happened...
Napalis
You saved my life.{nl}I was being chased by that huge monster and had to hide in here.{nl}
I should go back to where the others are.{nl}Thank you so much for saving me!
Nothing... Nothing terrible happened, I hope?
Looking at that red water makes me feel terrible.{nl}It's not even good to drink... not to mention it ruined our crops.{nl}
The waste was monumental.{nl}Our vegetables grew huge, but they were all left to rot as we couldn't eat them.{nl}
Everyone in the village was ready to go out and find the reason why the water turned red, but...{nl}The only person who has actually fought any monsters is Modis, the hunter.{nl}
I saw you fight those monsters earlier and you were really good.{nl}If that's okay, will you clear out some monsters around here?
We should be fine if we just stick together...{nl}I hope we don't run into trouble on our way to the village.
So it was right, what I saw. I knew it.{nl}Thank you!{nl}
I still feel a little uneasy, though...
The ground trembling... it seems odd.{nl}I wonder if it's related to the experiment...{nl}
Oh, right, my grandfather! I forgot about him.{nl}Please go back to the Absenta Reservoir, I don't want him to get in trouble again.
A vessel? That's odd.{nl}Someone was doing an experiment here... is that what you mean?{nl}
Hm... I never heard about any demons doing any sort of experiments...{nl}But it could be related to those black hoods that Modis saw.{nl}
I told you I saw them walking in and out of the Nesuga Small Corridor.{nl}Would you look into it?
I hope we can find something this time, too.{nl}I don't think I can rest now that I know it was someone who did this.
So, did you find anything?{nl}A picture? What is it?{nl}
Let's see... This looks like that red statue you found earlier.{nl}By the way, while you were gone I saw something strange.{nl}
I was taking a closer look at that statue you brought and...{nl}Suddenly, the water on the bucket next to it turned red.{nl}
Oh... the smell.{nl}If something like this exists but much bigger, then that must be what's tainting the water.
